INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a manner
that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the youth’s
behavior, chronological and developmental age, size, gender, physical
condition, medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history,
including any history of trauma, and must be done in a manner
consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/15/2023, while being restrained by a staff member, youth
sustained a scratch on his left arm by a clipboard.
2

Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on January 18, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Complainant stated he had
one correction from the original allegation which was that the scratch
was not on Youth A’s arm but rather “the left side of his body near his
armpit”. Complainant had nothing additional to report.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said he was
angry with Youth B for calling him a “bitch” after school. Youth A said
Staff 4 came from behind him and put him in a restraint for going after
Youth B. Youth A said there were other youth and staff around
however, he was unable to recall any specific names. Youth A said he
obtained a scratch on his left side and originally said it was from Staff
4’s keys, then stated it was actually from a clipboard Staff 4 had in his
hands at the beginning of the restraint, noting he had dropped it during
the restraint. Youth A said the restraint lasted “a couple minutes”. Youth
A said he did not believe Staff 4 intentionally scratched him or meant
any intentional harm to him, noting he has a good relationship with Staff
4.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said Youth
A was out of control on Monday after school. Youth B said Youth A was
trying “to fight” her outside of the school. Youth B said a staff was
standing in front of her however she could not remember who the staff
was. Youth B said Staff 4 restrained Youth A because he was being
aggressive and made the comments “I fucking hate you” to her. Youth
B said she saw the restraint and Staff 4 did not have anything in his
hands that she saw. Youth B said the restraint looked appropriate to
her. Youth B said Staff 4 walked Youth A to the bus, and they left.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said after
school several youth were outside getting ready to go back to their
houses when Youth B told Youth A that Youth C does not care about
him which upset Youth A. Youth C said Youth B and Youth A then
“went after each other” and Staff 1 stepped in-between the youth. Youth
C said that did not work and Youth B kept “going after” Youth A so Staff
5 put Youth A into a restraint. Youth C said Staff 5 had a pop bottle in
his hand, keys were on his belt, and had a clipboard that he set down
prior to restraining Youth A. Youth C said Youth A was still yelling but
eventually calmed down and got on the bus. Youth C said Youth B kept
antagonizing him and Staff 3 was trying to get Youth B away from
Youth A. Youth C stated Staff 4 was on the bus with other youth and
not present for the restraint.
4

Residential Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
January 18, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Residential Director said Youth A had been struggling in school most of
the day, having outbursts and going out of bounds. Residential Director
said after school the youth from the boy houses were all getting on the
bus while the girl youth were lining up to walk back to their houses.
Residential Director said Youth A did not walk to the bus with the rest of
the youth but rather was standing outside of the school arguing with
Youth B. Residential Director said Youth B escalated quickly and Youth
A moved towards her “swinging at her” at which time Staff 4 stood in-
between the youth to prevent Youth A from hitting Youth B. Residential
Director said Youth A continued to attempt to push past Staff 4 to get to
Youth B at which time Staff 4 placed Youth A in a standing hold.
Residential Director said Staff 4 was able to move Youth A to the bus at
which time Youth A seemed calm enough to be released. Residential
Director said Staff 4 was the only staff involved in the restraint and does
not recall him having anything in his hands. Residential Director said
the restraint was very quick, Youth A did not show much resistance and
he had no concerns about the appropriateness of the restraint.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Nurse said he did
not see any of the restraint but did see Youth A on January 17, 2023,
for a scratch on his left side. Nurse said the scratch resembled a
“sliding injury” as it started larger and then thinned out. Nurse said it
would be consistent with an injury from almost anything such as a
thumb, watch, or other object. Nurse said there are no signs of
infection, and the scratch was already forming a scab. Nurse did not
have concerns that it was an impact injury from a punch or strike.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she was
inside the school and did not see the incident between Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 1 said she did not see any restraint with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said she was
lining up the youth from her house when she heard Youth A outside
yelling. Staff 2 said Youth B walked outside and she followed her. Staff
2 said she was facing Youth B and had her back towards Youth A. Staff
2 said there was not a physical altercation between Youth A and Youth
B. Staff 2 said she was focused on getting Youth B back in the school
and did not see the restraint with Youth A.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said near the
end of the school day, she was leaving the gym and Youth A was
running around out of bounds. Staff 3 said she spoke to Youth A at that
time and got him to go back into the school and she took her youth out
to the transit bus to go back to the house. Staff 3 said she saw some
“commotion” and Staff 4 was restraining Youth A and walked him to the
bus and let go and Youth A entered without issue. Staff 3 said Youth A
did not complain of any issue regarding the restraint once on the bus.
Staff 3 said the restraint was appropriate and she did not have concern
about excessive force or an inappropriate positioning.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January 18,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said Youth A
was walking out of the school and was upset. Staff 4 said Youth A was
told that he could ride the bus back to his house instead of walking
back. Staff 4 said Youth C came out of the school telling him to calm
down and make good choices. Staff 4 said Youth B then came out and
began yelling at Youth C which made Youth A upset and he began to
yell at Youth B. Staff 4 said Youth A began to approach Youth B angrily
and so he stepped in front of Youth A and was trying to talk with him.
Staff 4 said Youth A was trying to push past him and at first, he did not
engage in a restraint however then Youth B called Youth A a “bitch”
and Youth A charged forward at Youth B at which time Staff 4 initiated
the restraint. Staff 4 said Youth A was not struggling much and he
walked him to the bus. Staff 4 said once on the bus Youth A was
calmed and did not complain of pain or injury. Staff 4 said he did have a
clipboard in his hand at the initiation of the restraint and tried to drop it
to the side however at one point it was “smashed” between him and
Youth A. Staff 4 said he spoke to Youth A the following day and Youth
A did not report any concerns to him at that time.
Staff 5 was interviewed via TEAMS, on January 26, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said Youth A was
upset at the end of the school day when all youth were dismissed and
heading back to their houses. Staff 5 said he was with his group of
youth at the transit bus when Youth A was upset outside yelling. Staff 5
said he witnessed the incident from the bus and was not involved in or
close to Youth A. Staff 5 said Youth A was yelling and “went after”
Youth B at which time Staff 4 stopped him by putting him in a restraint.
Staff 5 said the restraint was “a few minutes” and then Youth A came
and got on the bus. Staff 5 said Youth A was “fine” on the bus and did
not complain of any injury. Staff 5 said he did not see anything in Staff
4’s hands during the restraint. Staff 5 said from what he was able to see
he did not have any concerns about the way the restraint was
4

conducted. Staff 5 said there were other youth and staff around
however he was not able to remember who that included.
Documents Reviewed
• Incident Report 147560196 dated January 16, 2023, which was
consistent with staff and youth interviews.
• Youth A’s medical note dated January 17, 2023. The synopsis of
diagnosis stated: “Lt. Side abrasion post hold mid axillary line 7th
costal, approx. 2.5 in by 0.5 in redness with light abrasion down
the center without signs of infection. Width tapers on posterior
side. Very light bruising along the middle bottom just over 0.5 in
long. No diff breathing and mild pain.”
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had one disciplinary record for
use of improper restraint technique on October 13, 2022. Staff 4
completed his restraint training in Aegis on June 17, 2022, June
20, 2022, and a refresher on October 15, 2022.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with youth restraint. After interviews
with staff and youth it is determined Staff 4 performed the restraint
appropriately using trained techniques.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
